prompt.clinicalNote: **Summary:**- Age: 39 years old- Presenting complaints: Heavy menstrual bleeding, pelvic pain- BMI: 61- Three prior pregnancies, all delivered via cesarean section**Body:**Mrs. Smith, a 39-year-old female with a BMI of 61, presents with heavy menstrual bleeding and worsening pelvic pain, impacting her daily life. She has a history of fibroids, hypertension, and type 2 diabetes, with surgical history significant for appendectomy. The clinician recommends a pelvic ultrasound to assess the fibroids' size and location, considering a myomectomy or endometrial ablation due to the severity of symptoms and previous cesarean sections. A physical examination will be performed to rule out other gynecological issues.**Plan:**1. Schedule pelvic ultrasound to evaluate fibroids.2. Consider myomectomy or endometrial ablation based on ultrasound findings.3. Refer to a nutritionist for weight management.4. Schedule a follow-up appointment to discuss treatment options and address any questions or concerns.
